name: Bayan Islamic Graduate School
mission: Offer a world-class non-sectarian education and produce dynamic and ethical leaders and scholars grounded in the Islamic tradition.
programs: Master of Arts in Islamic Theological Studies
Master of Arts in Islamic Education
Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership
Master of Divinity (MDiv) in Islamic Chaplaincy
theoryOfChange: Bayan Islamic Graduate School has a published strategic framework that outlines its approach to achieving its mission and vision. Their mission is to offer a world-class non-sectarian education and produce dynamic and ethical leaders and scholars grounded in the Islamic tradition, with a vision for a world that understands Islamic values in a modern context. Their educational model emphasizes cultivating ethical leaders and scholars by bridging tradition with modern context through rigorous academic programs, personalized mentorship, and a commitment to community service. The curriculum, particularly for programs like the Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership, blends foundational Islamic teachings on leadership with modern disciplines such as strategic management, organizational behavior, project planning, and conflict resolution. This approach aims to equip graduates with intellectual depth, moral clarity, and practical skills to serve as imams, chaplains, scholars, and civic leaders, making a powerful impact in their communities.

evaluationSources: Accredited via partners Chicago Theological Seminary (ATS and HLC)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 32/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, education global cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Bayan shows good impact and good alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: Bayan holds a Charity Navigator score of 86.25/100 and holds 6.7 months of working capital.
The organization reported total revenue of $3,153,900, a program expense ratio of 52.0%, and fundraising efficiency of $0.29 per $1 raised.
Bayan offers Master's degrees in Religious Studies, Islamic Chaplaincy, and Islamic Theological Studies.
The institution accepts general charitable donations (sadaqah) to support its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Bayan earns a moderate overall score reflecting its specialized educational impact and stable financial health, though its program expense ratio leaves room for optimization. The institution serves as a critical capacity-building entity for the Muslim community in North America.
areas_for_improvement: The program expense ratio of 52.0% suggests a significant portion of funds is directed toward administrative or fundraising costs [2]
Increasing the directness of impact beyond capacity building could further strengthen the organization's profile [1]

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization offers a medium fit for donors seeking to support global education and Islamic scholarship [3]. As a sadaqah-eligible institution, it provides a transparent pathway for general charitable giving toward the advancement of religious literacy and ethical leadership [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: Bayan demonstrates moderate impact through its capacity-building model, focusing on the long-term development of community leaders and chaplains [3]. While it maintains a high data confidence level, its program expense ratio is 52.0%, indicating that just over half of its total revenue of $3,153,900 is spent directly on its educational programs [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: Bayan is a premier Islamic graduate institution dedicated to developing ethical leaders and scholars through world-class academic programs.
strengths: Strong financial health with 6.7 months of working capital available to sustain operations [1]
Efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.29 to raise every $1 in contributions [2]
Diverse academic offerings including a Master of Divinity in Islamic Chaplaincy [3]
baseline_narrative.summary: Bayan provides non-sectarian higher education grounded in the Islamic tradition, offering specialized Master's degrees in Religious Studies, Islamic Chaplaincy, and Theological Studies [3]. The organization reported a total revenue of $3,153,900 and maintains a solid financial standing with a Charity Navigator score of 86.25/100 [1][2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: Bayan earns a moderate overall score reflecting its specialized educational impact and stable financial health, though its program expense ratio leaves room for optimization. The institution serves as a critical capacity-building entity for the Muslim community in North America.

areas_for_improvement.context: The <cite id="14">program expense ratio of 52.0%</cite> is below the industry standard of 75%, suggesting a need to optimize administrative costs.
There is <cite id="15">insufficient data for cost-per-beneficiary calculation</cite>, which limits the ability to assess direct educational impact per dollar spent.

bbb_assessment.summary: BBB assessment data is currently unavailable for this institution.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains high reserves (6.7 months) to mitigate revenue stagnation risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="26">3-Year Revenue CAGR of -1.2%</cite> indicates stagnant growth.
Administrative overhead is higher than industry standards.
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="24">program expense ratio of 52.0%</cite>, which is significantly lower than the <cite id="25">peer median of 89.1%</cite>.

alignment.explanation: Bayan offers a strong fit for donors interested in <cite id="23">Islamic higher education</cite> and leadership development within the United States.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be improved by providing more clarity on how general donations support specific student scholarship funds.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust Bayan due to its <cite id="18">13-member board</cite>, <cite id="19">Silver Seal of Transparency</cite>, and high scores in organizational culture.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, Bayan could work toward a Gold or Platinum Candid seal by publishing more specific outcome metrics.

impact.explanation: The institution operates a capacity-building model with <cite id="20">verified evidence and outcomes</cite>, though its <cite id="21">program expense ratio of 52.0% (CN-adjusted)</cite> is lower than peers.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="22">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> to allow for cost-effectiveness benchmarking.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade B - Verified outcomes and documented Theory of Change

rich_narrative.headline: Bayan is a premier Islamic graduate institution dedicated to developing ethical leaders and scholars through world-class academic programs.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the long-term intellectual and institutional development of the American Muslim community through graduate-level academic excellence.
donor_motivations: Want to support the professionalization of Islamic chaplaincy
Believe in the importance of non-sectarian Islamic higher education
Value strong institutional governance and leadership metrics
giving_considerations: Donations support capacity building rather than direct emergency relief
The organization is currently in a stable but non-growth revenue phase
A higher-than-average portion of funds covers administrative and academic overhead
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking immediate humanitarian impact or those who prioritize charities with very high program-to-overhead ratios.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The institution has a <cite id="28">verified theory of change</cite> and outcome tracking, though specific cost-per-student metrics are not public.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Bayan creates impact by educating a new generation of scholars and chaplains who then serve thousands in hospitals, universities, and mosques.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that academic programs are effectively preparing leaders for real-world institutional challenges.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a specialized institution, Bayan has a high funding gap and capacity to expand its faculty and scholarship programs.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="27">non-sectarian graduate-level focus</cite> and diverse Master's degree offerings.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on higher religious services
similar_organizations.name: Darul Qasim

similar_organizations.differentiator: Larger focus on seminar-style community learning
similar_organizations.name: Al-maghrib Institute

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="7">6.7 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer to sustain academic operations during economic fluctuations.
Bayan demonstrates strong fiscal discipline by spending only <cite id="8">$0.29 to raise every $1 in contributions</cite>.
The institution is supported by a <cite id="9">13-member board</cite> and earned <cite id="10">perfect 100/100 scores in Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator.

strengths_deep_dive: Bayan's institutional strength is rooted in its academic rigor and organizational transparency. The school holds a <cite id="11">Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>, reflecting its commitment to public reporting. Beyond its financial metrics, the institution has secured prestigious external validation, including a <cite id="12">$234,500 grant from the Templeton Foundation</cite> to support its Advanced Islamic Theology and Contemporary Thought Program. This external funding highlights Bayan's capacity to compete for high-level academic grants and its reputation within the broader philanthropic landscape. Furthermore, the institution maintains an <cite id="13">independent board rate of 87%</cite>, ensuring robust oversight of its strategic mission.
rich_narrative.summary: Bayan is a premier Islamic graduate institution dedicated to developing ethical leaders and scholars through world-class academic programs. Founded in <cite id="1">2011</cite>, the institution provides non-sectarian higher education grounded in the Islamic tradition, offering specialized <cite id="2">Master's degrees in Religious Studies, Islamic Chaplaincy, and Theological Studies</cite>. The organization reported a <cite id="3">total revenue of $3,153,900</cite> in 2023, reflecting its role as a specialized academic hub for the American Muslim community. Bayan maintains a solid financial standing with an <cite id="4">overall score of 86.86.25/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. Its academic portfolio includes a <cite id="5">Master of Divinity in Islamic Chaplaincy</cite> and a Doctor of Ministry, designed to equip students for leadership roles in diverse institutional settings. The school has successfully diversified its income, generating <cite id="6">$1,432,214 in program service revenue</cite> alongside traditional contributions, which indicates a sustainable model for higher education.
